sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Ientaculum iudicum: or, A breake-fast for the bench prepared, presented, and preached in two sacred seruices, or sermons, the morning sacrifice before the two assises: at Thetford, at Norwich: 1619. Containing monitory meditations, to execute iustice and law-businesse with a good conscience. By Samuel Garey, preacher of Gods word in Win-farthing in Norff. Garey, Samuel, 1582 or 3-1646.
[8], 70 p.
Printed by B[ernard] A[lsop] for Matthew Law, and are to be sold by Edmond Casson at Norwich in the market-place, at the signe of the Bible, London : 1623.
Printer's name from STC. Cf. Folger catalogue, which gives signatures: A-K⁴ (-A1); pagination from NUC. "A manuall for magistrates" has separate title page. Running title reads: A breake-fast for the bench. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Ientaculum iudicum: or, A breake-fast for the bench prepared, presented, and preached in two sacred seruices, or sermons, the morning sacrifice before the two assises: at Thetford, at Norwich: 1619. Containing monitory meditations, to execute iustice and law-businesse with a good conscience. By Samuel Garey, preacher of Gods word in Win-farthing in Norff. Garey, Samuel, 1582 or 3-1646.
[8], 70 p.
Printed by B[ernard] A[lsop] for Matthew Law, and are to be sold by Edmond Casson at Norwich in the market-place, at the signe of the Bible, London : 1623.
Printer's name from STC. Cf. Folger catalogue, which gives signatures: A-K⁴ (-A1); pagination from NUC. "A manuall for magistrates" has separate title page. Running title reads: A breake-fast for the bench. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Edmond Casson
Matthew Law
B[ernard] A[lsop]
Norwich in the market-place, at the signe of the Bible
